title: Use of Project Labor Agreements for Federal Construction Projects

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to require project labor agreements on large-scale federal construction projects costing $35 million or more to promote efficiency, reduce labor disputes, and ensure smooth project completion. It also sets guidelines for exceptions, reporting requirements, training for contracting officers, and regulatory implementation.
potential_concerns: Requiring project labor agreements may reduce the pool of potential contractors, limiting competition and possibly increasing project costs.
The $35 million threshold and other criteria for large-scale projects might exclude some complex smaller projects that could benefit from labor agreements.
Implementation delays could occur while agencies develop regulations and training, creating uncertainty during the transition period.
Agencies may inconsistently apply exceptions, leading to disputes or perceptions of favoritism in contract awards.
Small businesses could face challenges navigating collective bargaining requirements despite stated protections.
